elements.description:
`<color-element>` adds a color selector to your page using Polymer.

```html
<color-element value="{{color}}"></color-element>
```
Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--transparency-pattern` | background pattern for the transparency layer | linear-gradient(45deg, rgba(0,0,0,0.15) 25%, transparent 25%, transparent 75%, rgba(0,0,0,0.15) 75%, rgba(0,0,0,0.15)),
linear-gradient(45deg, rgba(0,0,0,0.15) 25%, transparent 25%, transparent 75%, rgba(0,0,0,0.15) 75%, rgba(0,0,0,0.15)))
`--transparency-pattern-size` | size transparency pattern | 12px
`--color-element-badge-radius` | border-radius of the badge | --input-picker-border-radius, 6px
`--color-element-height` | height of the selector badge and the alpha- and the hue-slider| 184px
`--color-element-width` | width of the selector badge | 184px
`--color-slider-width` | width of the alpha- and the hue-slider | 16px
`--color-slider-padding` | padding of the alpha- and the hue-slider | 2px
`--color-pin-radius` | radius of the color pin | 3px
`--color-selector-mix-blend-mode` | mix-blend-mode of the selectors (sliders and color pin) | exclusion
`--color-element` | mixin applied to the color element | {}

Have a look at [input-picker-pattern#input-shared-style](https://github.com/fooloomanzoo/input-picker-pattern#input-shared-style) to see the used style-properties.

properties.name: hideRandomButton
properties.description: if true the random button is hidden

properties.name: propertyForValue
properties.description: defines the property that should be used for the value

properties.name: hex
properties.description: Hex-color

properties.name: r
properties.description: Red

properties.name: g
properties.description: Green

properties.name: b
properties.description: Blue

properties.name: h
properties.description: Hue

properties.name: s
properties.description: Saturation (hsl)

properties.name: l
properties.description: Lightness

properties.name: alpha
properties.description: Alpha

properties.name: alphaMode
properties.description: if true, colorString has alpha

properties.name: withoutAlpha
properties.description: if true, alpha won't be used

properties.name: hslPrecision
properties.description: Precision of hsl-colorStrings, if the format is 'hsl' (for saturation and lightness it is applied according to their percentage colorString)

properties.name: format
properties.description: format of the colorString (possible colorStrings: 'rgb', 'hex', 'hsl', 'auto')

properties.name: fixedFormat
properties.description: format is locked and does not switch according to the colorString

properties.name: _hexAlphaSupported
properties.description: if true, hex alpha is supported by the browser

properties.name: colorString
properties.description: value as color-string

properties.name: name
properties.description: name of the input

properties.name: title
properties.description: description for the element and can be used as a hint for invalid values

properties.name: value
properties.description: value of the input

properties.name: default
properties.description: default value of the value, when it does not validate

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: disables the input

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: required attribute

properties.name: required
properties.description: required attribute

properties.name: valueIsSet
properties.description: is true when the value is set

properties.name: _isSet
properties.description: defines whether the value is set

properties.name: _validate
properties.description: validates the value (when required)

methods.name: _computeColorElementContexts
methods.description: computes the canvas contexts of the color element

methods.name: _computeColorElementSizeProperties
methods.description: computes the size properties for the color element canvas

methods.name: _createTestCanvas
methods.description: creates a canvas for testing a color string and browser capabilities

params.name: oldColor
params.description: The old color string before setting

methods.name: _attachDom
methods.description: attach dom with `delegatesFocus: true` so that the element is also focussed while its's children are too, and to autofocus to first tabable

return.desc: true, if the value is set

params.name: isSet
params.description: The function that defines if the value is set

params.name: required
params.description: if true, the value is required

return.desc: true, if the value is valid

methods.name: _computeInvalid
methods.description: defines whether the value is set

methods.name: _computeValueIsSet
methods.description: defines whether the value is set

elements.description:
`color-picker` is a picker for color for **[Polymer](https://github.com/Polymer/polymer)** that can use the native input, too. If the **native** picker is choosen and is not supported, this element uses the **polyfill** datetime-picker. The `<calendar-element>` and the `<time-element>` will come in place if the native picker is not available or is not explicitly wanted. `css-value` will give you directly the css-string.

 ```html
   <color-picker value="{{value}}"></color-picker>
 ```

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--transparency-pattern` | background pattern for the transparency layer | linear-gradient(45deg, rgba(0,0,0,0.15) 25%, transparent 25%, transparent 75%, rgba(0,0,0,0.15) 75%, rgba(0,0,0,0.15)), linear-gradient(45deg, rgba(0,0,0,0.15) 25%, transparent 25%, transparent 75%, rgba(0,0,0,0.15) 75%, rgba(0,0,0,0.15)))
`--transparency-pattern-size` | size transparency pattern | 12px
`--color-element-badge-radius` | border-radius of the badge | --input-picker-border-radius, 6px
`--color-element-height` | height of the selector badge and the alpha- and the hue-slider| 184px
`--color-element-width` | width of the selector badge | 184px
`--color-slider-width` | width of the alpha- and the hue-slider | 16px
`--color-slider-padding` | padding of the alpha- and the hue-slider | 2px
`--color-pin-radius` | radius of the color pin | 3px
`--color-selector-mix-blend-mode` | mix-blend-mode of the selectors (sliders and color pin) | exclusion
`--color-element` | mixin applied to the color element | {}

 Have a look at `<color-element>` and [input-picker-pattern#input-shared-style](https://github.com/fooloomanzoo/input-picker-pattern#input-shared-style) to see the used style-properties.

properties.description: if true the random button is hidden

properties.description: hide the transparency pattern

properties.name: noRandomColorOnClick
properties.description: if true, clicking on the color badge won't generate a random color

properties.name: valueIsSet

properties.name: _isSet
properties.description: defines whether the value is set

properties.name: _validate
properties.description: validates the value (when required)

properties.name: native
properties.description: Set to `true` to use the native input, if it available

properties.name: nativeOnMobile
properties.description: Set to `true` to use the native input automatically on mobile devices, if it available

properties.name: mobileUserAgentTestString
properties.description: When `nativeOnMobile` is set to `true` this string is used to test the userAgent for a mobile device

properties.name: opened
properties.description: if `true` the picker is opened

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "left", "right", "center", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element vertically
relative to the related input element. Possible values are "top", "bottom", "middle", "auto". (comparable to `iron-fit-behavior` and its `no-overlap`-attribute)

properties.name: autoConfirm
properties.description: Set to `true` to make the input auto-confirming

properties.name: noCancelOnEscKey
properties.description: Set to `true` to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.

properties.name: noCancelOnOutsideClick
properties.description: Set to `true` to disable canceling the dropdown by clicking outside the picker.

properties.name: noCloseOnPickerOpened
properties.description: Set to `true` to disable closing the dropdown when opening another picker.

properties.name: noTip
properties.description: Set to `true` to disable the tip of the picker

properties.name: confirmedValue
properties.description: The confirmed value. When `auto-confirm` is not set, the value will only change, when you confirm.

methods.name: _computeConfirmedColorContext
methods.description: computes the canvas context of the recent color badge

methods.description: computes the size properties for the confirmed color badge canvas

methods.description: computes the canvas contexts of the color element

methods.name: _computeColorElementSizeProperties
methods.description: computes the size properties for the color element canvas

methods.name: _draw
methods.description: fills a canvas context with a color

params.description: The color string to be drawn.

params.name: width
params.description: The width to draw within the canvas.

params.name: height
params.description: The height to draw within the canvas

events.name: input-picker-closed
events.description:
input-picker-closed
Fired after a picker has been closed.

events.name: input-picker-opened
events.description:
input-picker-opened
Fired when a picker has been opened.

properties.name: alwaysOnTop
properties.description: Set to true to keep overlay always on top.

properties.name: noOverlap
properties.description: Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping it.

properties.name: withBackdrop
properties.description:
Set to true to display a backdrop behind the overlay. It traps the focus
within the light DOM of the overlay.

properties.name: noCancelOnOutsideClick
properties.description: Set to `true` to disable canceling the dropdown by clicking outside the picker.

properties.name: dynamicAlign
properties.description:
If true, it will use `horizontalAlign` and `verticalAlign` values as preferred alignment
and if there's not enough space, it will pick the values which minimize the cropping.

properties.name: autoFitOnAttach
properties.description: Set to true to auto-fit on attach.

properties.name: fitInto
properties.description: The element to fit the overlay into. By default it is the window.

properties.name: positionTarget
properties.description:
The element that should be used to position the overlay. If not set, it will
default to the polyfill node.

properties.name: hideRandomButton
properties.description: if true the random button is hidden

properties.name: hideTransparencyPattern
properties.description: hide the transparency pattern

properties.name: noRandomColorOnClick
properties.description: if true, clicking on the color badge won't generate a random color

properties.name: propertyForValue
properties.description: defines the property that should be used for the value
